channel.title: Custom WebClient help

item.title: Custom WebClient help
item.dc:creator: @Owner_satan Owner satan
item.description:
@Owner_satan wrote:

ok, whenever I try to make a custom webclient, i edit the signlink.java, so it looks like this:

[code=java]public static String findcachedir() {
String as[] = {“C:/”};
if(storeid < 32 || storeid > 34)
storeid = 32;
String s = “randomzpkzcache”;
for(int i = 0; i < as.length; i++)
try {
String s1 = as[i];
if(s1.length() > 0) {
File file = new File(s1);
if(!file.exists())
continue;
}
File file1 = new File(s1 + s);
if(file1.exists() || file1.mkdir())
return s1 + s + “/”;
}
catch(Exception _ex) { }
return null;
}

public static String sencondDir() {
	File file = new File("./");
	if (!file.exists())
		file.mkdir();
	return file.toString();
}

[/code]

So then i save + compile etc…
Then i got to my main client folder and remove the cache from it.
Then I run the client, and it downloads the cache in like 3 seconds, then it says starting up, then it says connecting to file server, and finally it will say error loading please report. What do i do to fix this? in my cachedownloader.java im using a drop box link, is that affecting it?

And yes my cache is named randomzpkzcache.
Thanks.

Read full topic
